policyDefinitionGroups.name: Application Control
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
The execution of executables, software libraries, scripts, installers, compiled HTML, HTML 
applications and control panel applets is prevented on workstations from within standard 
user profiles and temporary folders used by the operating system, web browsers and 
email clients.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Patches applied within 2 weeks
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in internet-facing  services are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an exploit exists.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Patches applied within 1 month
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in office productivity 
suites, web browsers and their extensions, email clients, PDF software, and security 
products are applied within one month of release.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Vulnerability scanner
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
A vulnerability scanner is used at least daily to identify missing patches or updates for
security vulnerabilities in internet-facing services.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Microsoft Office macros are disabled
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
Microsoft Office macros are disabled for users that do not have a demonstrated business 
requirement.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Microsoft Office from the internet are blocked.
policyDefinitionGroups.description: Microsoft Office macros in files originating from the internet are blocked.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Internet Explorer 11 does not process content from the internet
policyDefinitionGroups.description: nternet Explorer 11 does not process content from the internet

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Validate privileged access
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
Requests for privileged access to systems and applications are validated when first 
requested.

policyDefinitionGroups.name: Patch internet facing services
policyDefinitionGroups.description:
Patches, updates or vendor mitigations for security vulnerabilities in operating systems of
internet-facing services are applied within two weeks of release, or within 48 hours if an 
exploit exists.
